Author: dhendrickk
Title: [ANN][SALE] Hdac - Blockchain-based IoT contracts by Hyundai. 27th November
Body: Yes, correct. User-defined tokens can be assigned attributes to pay only for specific purposes in an IoT contract, and can prevent the user from being diverted to unwanted devices or uses. This plays a big role in providing transparency of using tokens while maintaining the security described above. For example, when parents transfer tokens to a minor, they may not want the child to buy alcohol or tobacco from a vending machine where the token is available. Tokens can carry attributes that prevent the purchase of particular goods such as alcohol or cigarettes sold via IoT devices, like vending machines, and therefore give parents more control over how the money they give their children will be spent."

Author: mme1022
Title: [ANN][SALE] Hdac - Blockchain-based IoT contracts by Hyundai. 27th November
Body: Hey Mavis. Here is the official statement regarding the pre-sale from Hdac: ---------------------------------------------------------- We understand that there were certain issues regarding questions about the presale information and we thank you for your patience. We have had long discussions regarding this matter and came up with some conclusions:  We will disclose only the total amount and the exchange (discount) rates for the rounds during the presale. (Specific details, for example amount per round etc. will be fully disclosed after the TGE with the amount raised through the TGE).  Total amount raised during the presale is about 14,000 BTC  A brief background on the presale: The Hdac Digital Transformation Community (DTC) officially began on March, 2017. Unlike other Alt coins, which partly improves the functions, we started off the development by targeting the Mainnet in the IoT area. Currently, the key functions of the IoT Contract, Payment, ePoW etc. are being developed in the corresponding order.  From April 2017, in order to meet the value of the technical implementation for Hdac, we began our first and a limited presale at a rate, 1 BTC : 35,000 DAC. Afterwards, we proceeded by correspondingly modifying the exchange rate as the following: in May, 1 BTC : 32,000 DAC and in July, 1 BTC : 28,000 DAC. Changes in the exchange rate with time, has been adopted due to the increase in the level of technical implementation for Hdac.  Currently, we are in a position where we can provide the Mainnet Hdac token since the Hdac token development is completed. Regarding this value, we decided to come up with the rate, 1 BTC : 18,000 DAC. Unlike what the presale participants have received as an exchange proof of Hdac, TGE participants will receive the officially released Hdac Token. Also, since the TGE was postponed due to KYC & AML issues, we are planning an event (TBA on November 27) for the participants where they will receive an extra 4,000 DAC per 1 BTC (meaning, if you buy for 1 BTC, you will receive 22,000 DAC in total: 18,000 + 4,000, that is, 25% bonus). There is also a Lucky Draw Event which is currently ongoing (11/10 ~ 11/24).  It has been 8 months after the presale and the crypto world has rapidly changed which had many external effects. However, Hdac is continuously developing and working to not only function as a currency which is simply traded on the exchange, but also to become the world’s best IoT Contract & Payment Blockchain.  Thank you.  The Hdac Team ----------------------------------------------------------  If Hdac fails to reach the target which is 6,000BTC, until the designated date Dec.22, the Hdac TGE will end as it is. and there won't be any additional token distribution such as 2nd TGE.

Author: bobq
Title: [ANN][SALE] Hdac - Blockchain-based IoT contracts by Hyundai. 27th November
Body: Which are the similarities and the differences of this project compared to Iota, which also aims to become the main vehicle of payments of the upcoming Internet Of Things?

Author: mme1022
Title: [ANN][SALE] Hdac - Blockchain-based IoT contracts by Hyundai. 27th November
Body: Hey PitL0rd2002.  There will be coins.  Quote from: bobq on November 19, 2017, 09:53:19 AM Which are the similarities and the differences of this project compared to Iota, which also aims to become the main vehicle of payments of the upcoming Internet Of Things?  Hi bobq. If i got it right, it seems that the main difference between Hdac and Iota is in the transactions validation method.  In Hdac every user can create is own private blockchain. In an environment such as a smart home or factory, various devices equipped with sensors, which are closely interconnected using a private blockchain, can be configured to operate more safely and reliably in accordance with each other’s conditions. A private blockchain is configured to perform not only user authentication but also mutual authentication between devices, generating and securely recording operation details and scenario-based IoT contracts. On the other hand, Iota is dealing with tokens and they choose another way to validate transactions. Which mean their technology is different and so is the solution they wish to provide to their clients. There are some similarities between the two project but i don't think they will produce the same product.

I think some of team members should clarify the community questions asked by the people.  Hi coin_1122!  To clarify it- HDAC is created through the cooperation of Hyundai BS&C, DEXKO, Doublechain, and Hyundai-Pay. Hyundai BS&C is not affiliated to Hyundai Motors of Hyundai Group. Which means there is no connection between Hyundai motors and Hyundai BS&C (but in real life they are family related). We got that question a lot and i guess we will in the future,  and every time it will be asked we will gladly explain the relation to Hyundai motors (which are not exist of course).

Body: Hi everyone! Just added Hdac ICO to my website https://concourseq.io/Q/Hdac. ConcourseQ is a collaborative due dilligence community that researches and reviews ICOs. Anyone with an account can submit information to your page, so we are reaching out to this community to get you all involved in the discussion. Thanks! (PS: Team welcome to add sale details)
